verses.plain: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

tokens.t: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth?
canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

verses.plain: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

tokens.t: Canst thou number the months
they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

verses.plain: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.

tokens.t: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.

verses.plain: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.

tokens.t: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.

verses.plain: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

tokens.t: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

verses.plain: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.

tokens.t: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.

verses.plain: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.

tokens.t: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.

verses.plain: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

tokens.t: The range of the mountains
his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

verses.plain: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?

tokens.t: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?

verses.plain: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

tokens.t: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

verses.plain: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

tokens.t: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength
great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

verses.plain: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?

tokens.t: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather
thy barn?

verses.plain: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?

tokens.t: the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?

verses.plain: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

tokens.t: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

verses.plain: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

tokens.t: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

verses.plain: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;

tokens.t: She is hardened against her young ones, as though
not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;

verses.plain: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.

tokens.t: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.

verses.plain: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.

tokens.t: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.

verses.plain: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?

tokens.t: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?

verses.plain: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.

tokens.t: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils
terrible.

verses.plain: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.

tokens.t: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in
strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.

verses.plain: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.

tokens.t: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.

verses.plain: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.

tokens.t: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.

verses.plain: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.

tokens.t: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that
the sound of the trumpet.

verses.plain: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

tokens.t: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

verses.plain: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?

tokens.t: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom,
stretch her wings toward the south?

verses.plain: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?

tokens.t: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?

verses.plain: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.

tokens.t: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.

verses.plain: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.

tokens.t: From thence she seeketh the prey,
her eyes behold afar off.

verses.plain: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.

tokens.t: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain
, there
she.

footnotes.text: of the driver: Heb. of the exactor
wings and…: or, the feathers of the stork and ostrich
He paweth: or, His feet dig
